class_notes:
(Topic: Queer Origins)


What have philosophers and artists proposed about queer origins, and what is at stake in the imagining of such origins? How do we understand queer acts throughout history, before the concept of sexual orientation emerged? How do literature and art, through clandestine codes and symbolism, transmit knowledge of a queer lineage and queer practices? To explore these questions and others, we will read across a broad range of literature from the Greeks to the present day. Students will be expected to participate in class discussions, and to complete course assignments including weekly reading responses, a close reading exercise, and two critical essays. Likely course texts include Sappho, Plato, Thomas Mann, Nella Larsen, James Baldwin, Anne Carson, Alison Bechdel and Andrea Lawlor.
course_description: An inquiry into the various expressions of human desire through readings of selected works of literature. Topics may include romance, psychoanalysis, gay and lesbian studies, or the four loves, classically conceived.
